comment: Kinda Willett-y, a lot of nut/peanut butter with a slight finish. Not bad, not great, Balcones still rules the tx roost imho.
Very smooth.  High vanilla flavors.  Nutty hint on finish. Good for sipping outside in the cold.  Not enough bite for me. For the price I'd go elsewhere.

A good sipping whiskey, this is nowhere near as harsh as many spirits and has a much smoother, sweet flavor. I can't pick out the flavors as well as others, but chilled this is one that I could sip on all night long. When I want something a little sweeter, this whiskey is my top pick. I just wish it was distilled in Texas instead of just blended here.
Smooth and pleasing. Very sweet though especially when served with ice

My favorite non-bourbon low proof whiskey.  Sweet and easy to drink.  I think it is too mellow for cocktails but then I prefer neat.  The only reason I didn't give it a 4th star is that I'm partial to high proof whiskey.
Our house whiskey; solid choice for an every day drinker

ridiculously overpriced for what is essentially maker's mark blended with neutral grain vanilla flavored spirit.  If you know you are getting something sweet, it isn't half bad. If you are expecting an actual bourbon taste, it is highly disappointing.  It can be most accurately described as one comment I read, "a childrens whiskey, if such a thing existed". (That wouldn't necessarily be a bad thing if it weren't $40 a bottle)

Simple nose. Sweet caramel, tons of vanilla, smooth. Candy in glass form. I love this whiskey, but you have to understand that it is not a standard whiskey. It's very sweet. Makes a killer Manhattan when you balance it with a heavier, chocolatey bourbon.

TX Blended whiskey from FR Distilling. A no age statement Texas bourbon, price $38.99 Sampled 8/4/15 with 3/4 teaspoon of water in a Glencairn spirits nosing glass.

Aroma - Vanilla cake, cookie dough, heavy caramel and yellow cake.

Taste - Vanilla, insanely heavy caramel, cherry cookie, almond, marzipan, butter, cola, maple and short bread cookies.

Finishes with a medium/quick fading flavor and no burn. 

Final score : 1.5 / 5, if ever such a thing existed as children's whiskey, this would be it. It's just so sweet with so many confectionary notes and no savory to round it out or balance them that I can't give it a high score. Might be a good starting whiskey for someone who doesn't like whiskey but wants to get into it or give it a try, but most seasoned drinkers I imagine will find this one unpalatably confectionary. Will not buy again.
My new favorite.  I was looking for an alternative to Crown, and this was recommended by a local bartender.  Very smooth, subtly sweet.  Good on the rocks or with Coke.

Nice, sweet whiskey with smells of vanilla and coco, and herbal notes. The taste on the palate has lots of butterscotch and citrus notes that fade away pretty quickly. Good blended whiskey on its own or in a Manhattan.

I tried this with dinner while traveling for business in Arlington TX. Wanted something local and this was all they had (passed up a MacAllan 15 for this). Intense sweet vanilla nose, almost confectionary. I knew there had to be some alcohol in there somewhere but I be darned if I could find it. Based on its nose, the taste was unsurprisingly sweet vanilla with a peppery aftertaste (ah! there's the alcohol). It had a very nice full mouth feel, kinda like a mouthful of marshmallows. Not one for an experienced sipper, this could be a great starter whiskey. Dry glass - vanilla ice cream.
Cotton candy aroma, vanilla icing flavors. I kept waiting for some oak notes or smoke, but no dice. You'll notice a bit of the classic youthful whiskey taste, which can remind you of a mild tequila.
Sweet vanilla nose. Sweet corn flavor with notes of vanilla. Sweet vanilla oak finish with a touch of nutty flavor.
I like it neat or mixed with ginger beer.
Love this whiskey! So easy to use in mix drinks and smooth to drink on the rocks. 10/10
my absolute fav. smooth, carmel finish.  tx is the best. Sept/ Oct  lost it mojo no smooth finish no Carmel flavor.

Sweet vanilla on the nose. Young but smooth on the tongue. The bottle top is the coolest part of the whiskey. Old (cowboy) boots are cut and the leather is used on the tops. Worth owning a bottle as a comparison for other blends.
Excellent for mixing. Ok straight, but nothing special.
Strong sugar nose with a cordial taste that is goes down like bad cognac.
Smooth. Sweet finish. Not much of a bite. Perfect sipping bourbon.
Gift from X, smooth, caramel taste, invigorating. Doug says 3.5
Very sweet whiskey, with vanilla spices.

Sipped neat. No idea what I drank, but it tasted like no other whiskey I've tried as of yet. The nose is rich creme brûlée and the taste is straight vanilla. It's buttery dessert in a glass. There's some nuttiness in there, but it's almost completely overpowered by sweet notes. The sweetness is cloying, however, and I found it extremely difficult to make it through a 2 oz. pour so I gladly shared it with the rest of the table. Some of the non-whiskey drinkers really enjoyed it. The mouth feel is also very thin. Gotta give credit for the unique flavor and distinct flavor profile, but in the end, this product isn't for me. It literally tastes like whiskey blended with vanilla extract.  If you like sweet dessert whiskies, this is definitely for you. If you like real whiskies, this is going to be a hard pass.
    Note: I would gladly sip this over some Tennessee Honey nonsense though
Sweet, cinnamon, hints of vanilla. Warming
Very smooth notes of vanilla and oak has a subtle heat finish with tones of smoke.
Smooth cream soda. Oak on the end
Good bourbon but not something I'd want in my shelf. Also only taste good in a bourbon glass not glencairn glasses.

Great drinker. About the only whiskey made in Texas that I care for. This whiskey has grown on me. Light, little sweet, and easy to drink. 
Rating: 3.5
Tasted in Alaska on the Disney Wonder

Not sure if I was eating vanilla ice cream or drinking whiskey. Not that I hate that, it just wasn’t what I was expecting. It’s got a place for me but likely not my go-to, however I would buy it again.

Nose: Sweet, Vanilla 
Alcohol Bite: Medium
Sweet vanilla and candy like nose. The vanilla definitely hits on the palate. Enjoyed it.
vanilla and fruit smell. smooth taste that matches the smell.
I didn’t know much about this before I tried it, but it definitely has a subtle hint of vanilla.

vanilla cream soda sweet smooth
maybe a little too sweet

My favorite whiskey.  I've never been able to find anything similar to this that's available everywhere (outside of Texas). If I have a girl over, and she doesn't like whiskey, chances are she'll still like this.  Could anyone recommend me something that's as smooth & sweet as this?
Very sweet and smooth. Great nightcap
Sooooo much vanilla that it mostly overpowers the other flavors.
Nose is pure butterscotch and toffee. Palate is moderately boozy but smooth, nice heat on the finish, sweet with notes of vanilla, nuts, and maybe some fruit.

Still trying to get behind this one with a third try. Nice vanilla and butterscotch on the nose with a hint of earthiness. Quick heat on the front end that rolls into a burn coupled with more vanilla, some char, and a touch of oak. Starts off like a sprint to the heat, but ends like a marathon with a long, bitter finish. A splash of water takes that bitter edge off, but thins away the vanilla and spice.
Heavy on the vanilla but quite smooth

An easy drinker for whiskey beginners. Sweet and creamy with lots of vanilla. However it is too sweet. Tastes like a vanilla milkshake. I am convinced this has to be mixed with added flavoring. The types of whiskey they blend into this is enteresting in theory.
Crazy sweet. Corn, vanilla, caramel. Booze.
Vanilla notes with a smooth caramel finish
Light and smooth but with woody depth
strong vanilla and almond/ nutty- really good!
Imagine yourself in the mountains of Colorado looking out into the world—by yourself—sitting down with a glass of this this by your hand... Is that all you need you ask? It is. Don’t question it.
Not as good as the bourbon, but is still a nice easy drink with a hint of sweetness.

Really enjoyed this whiskey. 

Very smooth. It’s what got me into bourbon.

Nose: very sweet vanilla. Smells like candy.
Palate: more vanilla, some honey. Extremely sweet, almost artificially sweet. No oil. Not rich. Virtually no burn throughout.
Cream soda, cream soda, cream soda
Butterscotch nose.Smooth, sweet pallet. Just a bit of heat.
Fruity, smooth sweet cinnamon vanilla, light on the nose easy to drink
Sweet, vanilla and butterscotch notes on the palate. Very smooth.
Vanilla cream soda on the nose and lovely finish
Straight Vanilla extract, too sweet for my taste.  Maybe good mixer but for a good neat pour I’ll pass...
Nice and smooth vanilla taste. Not to bold on the back side. Good everyday goto
I like it. Easy to drink, affordable. Vanilla explosion, but not so sweet that it replaces dessert tonight.
Easy to drink straight, good flavor.
Tons of vanilla, scents of Pecan. Fantastic bottle

This is pretty much an amped up version of crown vanilla. Tastes more like a flavored whiskey than regular whiskey - but the vanilla and caramel are pleasant. Too sweet for my personal liking, but I can see why this is popular.
Sweet. Definitely a pecan aroma. Opens up nicely on the rock
so much vanilla deliciousness stop being a whiskey prick and enjoy them all
It says vanilla & almond.  I tasted frangelico ... hazelnut.  Simple, yet delicious.
Absolutely delicious. Sweet smell and sweet taste including the finish.
Sweet, smooth, unique one of a kind flavor
If you enjoy the sweet stuff, this is a great go to Whiskey that won’t punch you in the face!! Smooth Vanilla sweetness on the rocks or even mixed with another TX favorite Dr. Pepper.

Caramel nose and very smooth and sweet. Made me want to eat ice cream while drinking it. 

Bought in San Antonio when looking for a Texas bourbon to try.
Super Butterscotch. I saw it in the reviews and they were spot on.
All the sweetest things: warm caramel,  butterscotch, melting ice cream, your afternoon white coffee. Not bad, for sure surprising.
Too incredibly seeet, to the point it’s offputting.
To me it's like drinking liquid pecan pie.  It is definitely different than the usual American whiskey.  Maybe explains the low score by the official reviewer.  Enjoyable for the price.
Notes of vanilla. Very smooth and drinkable.
lots and lots of vanilla. pretty smooth. very easy drinking.
Smooth; sweet. Holds up great in Old Fashioned
I really enjoyed it on ice.  Smooth, decent finish.  Neat - not so much.
Very smooth with lots of vanilla.
It’s vanilla cream soda in whiskey form. Too sweet to drink neat. Holds up well in a mixer if you want a nice vanilla kick. Tastes good with coke
Candy and baked goods sweet. Brown sugar heavy. Rich with tons of mouth feel. Almost syrup-y.

Vanilla dominates the taste with orange and sugary caramel. Sweet caramel on the nose. Maybe orange blossom as well. It’s mostly smooth and easy to drink with no alcohol burn. The finish is caramel and vanilla and lingers for a minute before fading to vanilla

Got this at a bar in SAT. Small cocktail glass. Smells vanilla, sweet, and inoffensive. The taste is largely what you expect from the nose: VANILLA! A little bit of spice, making me think rye but may be the alcohol, on the swallow and finish. 

All in all not bad. Not a superstar whisky. This seems like a good background whisky that is approachable and will not demand your attention. The vanilla may fatigue your palate after awhile. 

Unlikely to purchase again but would not turn down.
Really enjoying this one...used just one small ice cube to stave off the burn.
Smooth over ice, hints of vanilla
It's too sweet and has a vanilla syrup finish. Kinda reminds me of Southern Comfort.

Too much vanilla to enjoy unfortunately. Best on ice.

I use the rating scale below. Distiller uses a scale of 5 and I use a scale of 10, but I’m sure you’re not too drunk to do the math! 

1. Disgusting - So bad I poured it out.
2. Poor - I wouldn't consume by choice.
3. Bad - Multiple flaws.
4. Below average - Not bad, but many things I'd rather have.
5. Good - Just average.
6. Very Good - Better than average.
7. Great - Well above average.
8. Excellent - In a league of its own.
9. Incredible - An all-time favorite.
10. Perfect

Nose: heavy vanilla

Palate: vanilla, oak, spice

Finish: short, no burn
Vanilla. I love this whiskey almost as much as I love Texas itself.
Strong pepper front, small vanilla, small caramel/maple.  No finish.

I really enjoyed it. It’s almost a dessert whiskey. Strong taste and smell of maple syrup and toffee. Also vanilla and caramel. Subtle taste of coke. Very sweet with a brown sugar flavor. No real oak or smokiness whatsoever.

Very sweet, great as a sipper, not so much as a mixer due to the sweetness.  Strong flavors of butterscotch and caramel, such that it's almost like a sugary flavored latte.  I get less vanilla than others
Strong brown sugar and vanilla; medium spice; great mixer with coke zero

For a blended whiskey, this was incredibly sugary. Slightly hard to pick out anything beyond the apparent vanilla, but also surprisingly simple and adequate at the same time. Would recommend trying for the heck of it, but isn’t something I would revisit
The taste and smell is strong with Vanilla. I’m still new to drinking neat so the alcohol was there for me but it seemed light.
Very smooth. A little overpowering vanilla flavor but pleasant aftertaste. Slightly watered down potentially.
Heavy cream soda on the nose. Not picking out any predominant flavors...just a smooth, fluffy, easy drinking whiskey. 3.57.
Probably won't ever make it too high on anybody's list because it's blended, but it's definitely one of the most drinkable things out there.
